author: nc1234
content: I have a question: because we add `inclusionListTransactions` field to `PayloadAttributesV4`, that means we also need to update beacon apis' [eventstream](https://github.com/ethereum/beacon-APIs/blob/33b6bb789cc301bab7ec2e865f89073341cea6ba/apis/eventstream/index.yaml#L121), that means we need to deal with ssz

author: nc1234
content: In ssz's context `inclusionListTransactions` will be a list, so we need give it a max length

author: nc1234
content:
~~The problem is, there is no limit on number of IL txs. `InclusionListStore` at most can store `INCLUSION_LIST_COMMITTEE_SIZE` ILs,  and each IL can be at most  `MAX_BYTES_PER_INCLUSION_LIST` large for each (slot, ilc_root). <@845691100072509460> <@592004585506340885>~~
Looks like it is `inclusionListTransactions` max length is going to be `MAX_TRANSACTIONS_PER_PAYLOAD * INCLUSION_LIST_COMMITTEE_SIZE`

author: nc1234
content: Also looks like engine API spec is missing [`is_inclusion_list_satisfied`](https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/master/specs/_features/eip7805/fork-choice.md#new-is_inclusion_list_satisfied) is that right? Or is it referring to `engine_newPayloadV5`?

author: nc1234
content: If an ILC member broadcasts two ILs, their contents are the same, except transactions are in different order, would that count as equivocation? From this [condition](https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/08066798d2f144b4ae63222cc0537c512ae00c00/specs/_features/eip7805/inclusion-list.md?plain=1#L68) the order of transactions must be equal

author: jih2nn
content: Do you want to include this in your [PR](https://github.com/ethereum/beacon-APIs/pull/490)?

author: jih2nn
content: That's actually a conceptual API for spec writing. Using `newPayload` makes the CL spec stateful, which should remain as stateless. The discussion reached to a consensus to introduce `is_inclusion_list_satisfied` API in the spec while the implementation still uses `newPayload`'s response to tell if the payload satisfies the IL constraints, same as before. For more details, please refer to this [article](https://hackmd.io/@jihoonsong/S1c2dhMrle) I've shared some time ago.

author: nc1234
content: Yea I have just rebased the beacon api on top on fulu

author: jih2nn
content: Oh good catch, thanks! I think they should compare the set of `transactions` field. Let me correct it with some unit tests

author: jih2nn
content: FOCIL breakout #18 in <t:1756216800:R>! Please add agenda if you have any: https://github.com/ethereum/pm/issues/1701
